input_text:
Job Title: Health Insurance Rates Examiner

Location: Richmond, VA

Employment Type: full-time

Listed Skills: Analyst, General Business

Description:
Health Insurance Rates Examiner  Anticipated Starting Salary Range: $50,000 - $60,000 Starting Salary Commensurate with Qualifications and Experience 
The State Corporation Commission’s (SCC) Bureau of Insurance (BOI) seeks a Health Insurance Rates Examiner to join our Life & Health Division, which regulates life and health insurance companies in Virginia. Our mission is to ensure that the citizens of the Commonwealth are provided with access to adequate and reliable insurance protection, and that the insurance policies are of high quality, are understandable, and are fairly priced. The Health Insurance Rates Examiner primarily reviews accident and sickness insurance rate submissions to ensure compliance with the Virginia Insurance and Administrative Code. The SCC offers a hybrid work schedule (generally 3 days of telework, 2 days in office each week), on-the-job training, and opportunities to obtain related certifications and designations. 
Job Responsibilities Analyze and review insurance rates and policy forms Determine rate filings’ compliance with insurance laws, regulations, and administrative rules Communicate with insurers and their consultants verbally and in writing about results of a review Assist with making necessary corrections to the filings Maintain clear and accurate records of all filings in accordance with section procedures Conduct research and highly detailed analysis Read and comprehend Virginia insurance laws and regulations Attend meetings and trainings, participate in special projects and team analysis, and complete related work as assigned 
Preferred Qualifications Professional experience in health insurance and/or insurance rate reviews and filings Ability to review insurance rates and perform basic analysis of numbers and data Proficiency with general office software applications, including MS Excel Strong verbal and written communication skills with keen attention to detail with language and data Ability to read, understand, interpret, and apply sections of the Virginia Insurance and Administrative Code and to correctly determine their applicability to provisions in rate filings Willingness to ask questions, conduct research, and seek answers Ability to work independently and efficiently prioritize assignments Ability to establish and maintain professional relationships with SCC staff and industry personnel Knowledge of insurance terminology, underwriting, claims handling, and laws and regulations applicable to health insurance, ACA, long-term care, Medicare supplement, or managed care plans is a plus A college degree is desirable, but not required; however, without related professional experience, a bachelor’s degree is a minimum requirement 
SCC Information Located in downtown Richmond, Virginia, the SCC is a state agency with regulatory authority over many business and economic interests in Virginia. More information about the SCC may be found on our website: www.scc.virginia.gov. 
The SCC offers its employees rewarding, impactful public service work; flexible telework options and work-life balance; and professional development opportunities. The SCC fosters a high-performing workforce with a commitment to diversity and inclusion, collaboration, and alignment with the SCC’s mission and strategic goals. Core benefits provided to SCC employees include competitive health and life insurance programs, pre-tax spending accounts, leave programs, and paid state holidays. Employees participate in a state retirement plan with options for tax-deferred retirement savings including employer matching. The state funds a short and long-term disability program. 
The SCC regulates various companies and industries in Virginia; therefore, to avoid any conflict, employees are required to sign a Conflict of Interest Form and must dispose of any stock they hold in a regulated company or dispose of any licenses or certificates they hold in any industry regulated by the SCC unless otherwise permitted. Employees also shall report employment of household members by a regulated company. 
The SCC is an Equal Opportunity Employer. Military veterans and national service alumni are encouraged to apply. The SCC uses the E-Verify system to confirm identity and work authorization and does not provide sponsorship. If requested, the SCC will provide reasonable accommodation to applicants in need of accommodation to provide access to the application and interview process. A background investigation is conducted on the selected candidate as a condition of employment. 
The information you submit must clearly demonstrate your experience and qualifications as it relates to this position. Interview consideration is based on the information submitted online. 
This position is classified in the SCC Salary Structure as a Grade P-7 or Grade P-9 and will be non-exempt or exempt from the provisions of the Fair Labor Standards Act (FLSA) depending on the candidate’s qualifications and experience. 
How to Apply This position will remain open until filled; however, interested candidates are strongly encouraged to apply by May 3, 2024. 
Qualified candidates are encouraged to apply on the SCC Career Center website at https://careercenter.scc.virginia.gov.

Experience Level (if available): Associate
